definitions.definition: fully prepared for what you are going to do and able to start it immediately
definitions.sensetop: ready for somethingready to do something

examples.text: Just a minute—I'm **almost ready**.
Are you nearly ready?
‘Shall we go?’ ‘I'm **ready when you are**!’
I'm just **getting** the kids **ready** for school.
Right, we're ready to go.
We were **getting ready** to go out.
Volunteers were **ready and waiting** to pack the food in boxes.
He's always ready with a quick answer.
I think we're just about ready to start.
I was all ready to leave when the phone rang.
I'm trying to get the children ready to leave.
Our troops keep training all the time to remain ready.
We're definitely ready for the show tonight.

definitions.definition: having the experience, attitude, etc. that you need in order to be able to deal with something
definitions.sensetop: ready for somethingready to do something

examples.text: Her husband wants to start a family, but she isn't ready.
I’m not sure if Karen is ready for marriage yet.
I was twenty years old and **ready for anything**.
He is clearly not ready to take on such an important role.
He didn't feel quite ready for marriage.
I feel ready for anything!
She was concerned to protect the children from the truth until she judged them ready to hear it.

definitions.definition: completed and available to be used
definitions.sensetop: ready for somethingready to do something

examples.text: Come on, dinner's ready!
The new building should be ready by 2030.
Can you help me **get** everything **ready** for the party?
The contract will be ready to sign in two weeks.
I've left everything ready in the kitchen.
I'll get all the boxes ready.
The cases are ready for delivery.
The suitcases were standing ready by the front door.
The plane was refuelled and declared ready for service again.

definitions.definition: available to be used easily and immediately

examples.text: All the relevant records are **ready to hand**.
a ready supply of wood
a ready source of income
Please have your tickets ready for inspection.
He held his gun ready.
The warships were soon made ready.

definitions.definition: willing and quick to do or give something
definitions.sensetop: ready for somethingready with somethingready to do something

examples.text: I was very angry and ready for a fight.
She's always ready with advice.
He's always **ready and willing** to help.
Don't be so ready to believe the worst about people.
She was only too ready to believe the worst of him.
Connors was more than ready to oblige.
He's always ready to help.

definitions.definition: likely to do something very soon

examples.text: She looked ready to collapse at any minute.

definitions.definition: needing something as soon as possible

examples.text: Right, I'm ready for bed.
After the long walk, we were all ready for a rest.
She has great charm and a ready wit.

definitions.definition: to prepare for something; to prepare something for something

examples.text: to make ready for the President’s visit

definitions.definition: what you say to tell people to start a race

examples.text: The show is just about ready to roll.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old English rǣde (from a Germanic base meaning ‘arrange, prepare’; related to Dutch gereed) + -y.
